title: Republic of Congo 2016 License Round and Technical Roadshow
locations: Hydrocarbures de la République du Congo
Republic of Congo • Republic of Congo
text: Distribution channels: Banking, Finance & Investment , Business & Economy ... Republic of Congo 2016 License Round and Technical Roadshow CAPE TOWN, SOUTH AFRICA, October 15,   The 22nd Africa Oil Week 2015 (26-30th October) in Cape Town features over 40 Governments, National Oil Companies and Licensing Agencies, plus several Ministers and Government Delegations. A stand-out Roadshow event is the Republic of Congo Licensing Round 2016, announced and opened at the Africa Upstream Conference. Following formal ratification of the new Petroleum Code by Parliament, HE Jean-Marc Thystere Tchicaya, Ministre des Hydrocarbures de la République du Congo, will inaugurate the 2016 License Round of open blocks in the Coastal and Cuvette Basins in 2016. The Minister will also host a Technical Roadshow - with the PSC Template, timing, terms and conditions presented during the Roadshow, and with Ministerial, DGH and SNPC Delegations in attendance. The License Round and Roadshow is supported by PGS. Republic of Congo: 2016 License Announcement Minister’s Address: Tuesday 27th October, Session-2: Main Auditorium, CTICC Roadshow: Licensing Round 2016 Program Wednesday, 28th October: 11:00 to 14:00, in Room 1.40 Chair: PGS, Senior Executive • Ministry of Hydrocarbons, Republic of Congo • Republic of Congo – General Business Environment • New Petroleum Code • License Round Details • Prospectivity – Open Blocks in the Round The Ministry and SNPC have an Exhibition Booth at the Conference, open for Monday to Friday, 26-30th October, and the Government Delegation will be available for private meetings at the 22nd Africa Oil Week 2015. The Roadshow is only open to registered Delegates at the 22nd Africa Oil Week. Attendees are invited to join this important occasion and to participate in the Congo Roadshow event, as well as be present at the Minister’s Opening Announcement, as well as hear presentations from SNP, the Ministry and PGS and meet and engage with the Ministerial Delegation at the Congo Roadshow during our Conference.
